resources.string: Your personal aid for deciphering\nthe Japanese language.
This should only take a few seconds.
Don\'t get words and meanings online
Merge online search results with local results
Display the list immediately when finding results, and refresh it when getting online results
Wait for online results before showing the list
Add matching verbs by checking conjugations
Display the list immediately when finding results, and refresh it when finding matching verbs through the conjugation search
Wait for matching verbs results before showing the list
Don\'t show extra information on each word
Don\'t show informative popup texts on search
Show informative popup texts on search
Please state your query in English.
Please state your query in Japanese.
Please select text line to copy to input
Current Android version is too low
OCR engine was not initialized. Trying again…
A long processing time may mean the OCR engine is having trouble deciphering the image and will result in random OCR text. In such case you should try using a better picture.
Please wait until the OCR data finishes downloading.
Successfully installed data from Downloads Folder.
Please select and crop Japanese text. For best results, select a FEW symbols occupying a large area in a clear picture. Otherwise the OCR engine may not work properly.
Please select and crop English text. For best results, select a FEW words occupying a large area in a clear picture. Otherwise the OCR engine may not work properly.
Sorry, it appears your phone does not have Speech-To-Text functionality. Redirecting to relevant resources…
Please select how you want to download the required Japanese Optical Character Recognition data (approx. 40MB).
Please select how you want to download the required English Optical Character Recognition data (approx. 20MB).
Not found in local dictionary. Searching in other sources…

Please enter a valid word.

Complete words will yield the best results, but word fragments will also do.

You can enter words in English, Romaji, Hiragana, Katakana or Kanji.

Also note that this app uses a variation of Kunrei-Shiki romanization where all kana homophones are transliterated to unique Romaji forms, thereby allowing for unambiguous transliterations.

Please enter a valid verb conjugation. 

In order to keep the search time reasonable, not all verb tenses are included. As such, please observe the following rules: 

When looking up less common conjugations (e.g. tabesaseta), you may have to convert the verb to present tense (tabesaseru). 

If you're searching for a compound verb (e.g. tabete ikimasu), you must first convert the second verb to its dictionary form (tabete iku). 

If you're searching for a verb addition (e.g. taberu bakari), use the <DICT> search on "bakari" to look up the corresponding grammar rule. 

The <DICT> search also covers alternate Romaji or Kanji spellings for a variety of verbs (in dictionary form). The <CONJ> search only looks up conjugations for the most common Romaji spelling and Kanji interpretation of each verb.
You can also enter an English verb in ing/infinitive form.
Check the rules below for hints.

Hint: 
Use an apostrophe (') after "n" to ensure its transliteration to "ん". 

Also note that this app uses a variation of Kunrei-Shiki romanization where all kana homophones are transliterated to unique Romaji forms, thereby allowing for unambiguous transliterations.
1. Select your wanted Kanji\'s overall structure

Hint: 
Enter a Kanji into the Search bar and click on the decomposition (好 > 女+子) button in order to get its decompositions. 
 
The decompositions are evaluated using a heavily modified and corrected version of Gavin Grover's decomposition database (see cjkdecomp.codeplex.com).
Japanese Toolbox is an app created by a Japanese learner for Japanese learners.

The app is designed to help you decipher texts in intermediate to advanced Japanese at a faster pace than other tools, allowing you to understand the meanings and components of every word or phrase you read.
The app does not depend on an Internet connection, so you can use it whenever and wherever you want.
A local dictionary of Japanese words, expressions and grammar rules.
Better than most online reference tools, you can find explanations on any grammar rule just by entering a relevant keyword, even partially.
I manually expanded the dictionary over the years with extra meanings and alternate word forms, so you will find words that many online dictionaries fail to find.
If there is Internet access then online results are added (you can change this in the Settings menu).
A verb conjugator with more than 140 conjugations for more than 2000 regular verbs and more than 3300 suru verbs.

If you search for a conjugated verb (in Romaji, Kana or Kanji form) with this function, a unique reverse-search engine will find all possible matching verbs and give the relevant conjugation\'s meaning.
Though there are various ways of transliterating Kana syllables to Romaji and back, I chose the way that will feel most intuitive to Western learners and is compatible with most modern conventions.

Find any Kanji based on up to 4 radicals/components or by identifying its general structure. You can find components by selecting one of the 214 radicals or their common variants, or by searching a list of common Kanji components (ordered by popularity). You can also filter the results by entering the wanted reading, meaning or radical number.
The search engine is way better than what you\'ll find online, since I manually inspected and corrected the original components database that online sites rely on.
Note that users of older Android versions may experience extra \"blank symbols\" instead of Japanese characters, that can\'t be filtered out.
Get the meanings and readings of all of the components in a given Kanji, recursively.
Very useful if you want ot understand Kanjis through their radicals.
A Text-To-Speech function so that you may listen to your query in English or in Japanese.
You can choose the speech language in the Settings menu.
Convert Japanese or English words to searchable text by taking a picture or using an image in your device. This function works offline.
You can choose the text recognition language and initial image saturation/contrast/brightness in the Settings menu.
A Speech-To-Text function for Japanese or English speech.
You can choose the speech recognition language in the Settings menu.
If you have any comments or feedback, or encountered a bug, you\'re welcome to post them at japanesetoolboxapp@gmail.com.

I built JapaneseToolbox on my spare time out of love for the Japanese language and to help people learn Japanese faster. The app will always remain FREE and ad-less, and no information you entered in the app is in any way used for purposes other than the services provided in the app.

The source code for the project is freely available at https://github.com/blarom/JapaneseToolbox. You can copy the code to your heart\'s content! I encourage the free sharing of knowledge, and if you want to build an app with similar functions, you\'re more than welcome to do so. Just don\'t forget to credit me, I spent a lot of time developing these tools :)
Credits - Part of the app\'s tools are based on following:
The OCR engine is provided by the Tesseract open-source project (supported by Google).
The Text-To-Speech and Speech-To-Text functions are based on Google APIs.
Picture manipulation is provided by the ArthurHub library (https://github.com/ArthurHub/Android-Image-Cropper).
Image sharpening is provided by Pete Houston\'s algorithm (https://xjaphx.wordpress.com/2011/06/22/image-processing-sharpening-image/).

The CJK character decompositions database is originally based on the cjkdecomp database by Gavin Grover (https://github.com/amake/cjk-decomp - see disclaimer*), which I heavily modified and corrected.

The local dictionary is a reduced form of the open-source EDICT dictionary, which I modified and manually upgraded to suit the app\'s needs. Some other sources were used, including wiktionary.org for updating the suru verb meanings.

*disclaimer for cjkdecomp:
Copyright 2017 Gavin Grover

Access to the camera is needed for detection
This application cannot run because it does not have the camera permission. The application will now exit.
MB left in internal memory and can\'t install the OCR data. Please clear some app data and try again.
Failed to connect to the Internet.
Installing the central words database.\n~ May take up to one minute ~
Finished installing the central database.\nCurrently installing the Kanji database.\n~ May take up to 3-5 minutes ~
The database is currently being installed.\nThis may take a few minutes.\nThis delay only occurs when installing or upgrading the app.
Are you sure you want to exit the app?
No new words or meanings found online.
This component is a CJK Character.
Your search is too broad. Please select another structure or select Kanji elements to narrow the search.
No results found for your selections.

The original image has saturation 1.0 (normal colors), contrast 1.0 and brightness 0. \n\nOptimal values for character recognition are around saturation 0 (grayscale), contrast 3.0 and brightness -0.5. These are the default settings, but feel free to change them to make the image as clear as possible. You can adjust these defaults in the Settings menu.
Invalid input, default value set instead.
You cannot set a value outside of the range
